definition: to pass on (something, such as responsibility, rights, or powers) from one person or entity to another
examples: devolving to western Europe full responsibility for its own defense

definition: to pass by transmission or succession
examples: the estate devolved on a distant cousin

definition: to fall or be passed usually as a responsibility or obligation
examples: the responsibility for breadwinning has devolved increasingly upon women

definition: to come by or as if by flowing down
examples: his allegedly subversive campaigns … devolve from his belief in basic American rights

definition: to degenerate through a gradual change or evolution
